intro: Conyza celebica, commonly known as the Java ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a cluster, making it visually distinct. Conyza celebica is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
